call_title: Commercial Barter Meets Permissionless Infrastructure — Cannon (Ergo Meetup 2025)

open_questions.question: What would it take to attract a dev to do this?
open_questions.context: Discussion about development resources needed for barter exchange infrastructure

open_questions.question: What piece of the pie is for the dev?
open_questions.context: Discussion about monetization and revenue sharing for developers

open_questions.question: Can you chicken an egg? And do you try to replicate the software for one and get others to join for interoperability across the networks?
open_questions.context: Discussion about bootstrap strategy for network adoption

key_facts.fact: Bartering worldwide or in North America is about a 12 to 14 billion dollar market
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: iTex is the biggest network doing 140 million annually
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Local trade partners are doing about 10 million a year
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Rocky Mountain Barter does about half a million a year
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Total scale is two and a half billion conservatively a year for the last several years
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: About 400 barter exchanges across the globe
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Inter-exchange volume is probably about 20 million out of 2.5 billion moving across these exchanges
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Only 40 exchanges are in BANC (Barter Association National Currency)
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: There's over 200 exchanges across the US
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ

key_facts.fact: Universal currency has a hundred of the exchanges globally
key_facts.speaker: CannonQ
